cyclone.name: PETER
cyclone.current_location: about 435 miles east of the northern Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest with a gradual turn toward the northwest; forecast to skirt well north of the Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands, and Puerto Rico before moving into the open Atlantic toward Bermuda’s vicinity late week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No landfall forecast – center expected to remain over water north of Puerto Rico

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect (interests in Virgin Islands & Puerto Rico advised to monitor)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Outer-rain-band impacts possible from the northern Leeward Islands westward through the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed for San Juan in advisory wind-probability table
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 mph) possible in squalls Monday into early Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; minor tide run-up and rip-current risk along north-facing beaches
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches with isolated higher amounts; brief urban and small-stream flooding possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning late Sunday night and persisting through Tuesday
